title: Ashe rework discussion, thoughts and questions and concerns
body:
Hello, PRAISE THE LORD ASHE BUFFS HAVE ARRIVED 

however I'd like to discuss them with everyone :D!

here are some basic discussion related questions you can answer if you dont know what to else to say:
1- Are you glad for the buffs?(my answer: yes
2- What do you think of her new kit?(my answer: I think the passive might be a little bit broken with no cost for the slow)
3- any ideas for possible new meta builds? ( my answer: machine gun ashe baby {{item:3085}} )
____________________________________________________________________

now my own personal thoughts on the new kit

Passive: I think the passive might be a tad broken, You are giving ashe an unlimited slow with no risk or cost to it?! 
Back when it costed mana at least it was balanced so nobody would be perma slowed. However I am glad ashe is no longer "punished" in her passive for auto attacking

Q: Seems great, although It could be a problem depending on how the extra arrows scale

W: more arrows yes! cone width reduced no D:!

E: No more gold D:? also THIS IS probably going to need to be nerfed, Its not basically a global ward that youll have to check something every so often, unless the CD is super high perhaps making it global isnt the best idea?

R: No discussion needed here on my side

_______________________________________________________________

QUESTIONS FOR RIOT
1) Aren't you worried that Ashe will become to powerful with the perma-slow and it having no negative effect on ashe now?
2) On Ashe's Q will the extra arrows scale with DMG and also apply a slow? once you hit 5 stacks, if this is the case
Doesn't that make it possible she can also have those extra arrows with no negative effects to her as long as she keeps attacking?
3) Why did you reduce the width of the cone for her arrows but add more arrows?
4) Why does her hawkshot no longer grant gold? 
5) What will the CD/negative effects be like to prevent the global hawkshot from being to overpowered in vision control
________________________________________________________________________

concerns:

passive: perma slow, with no negative effects on ashe for doing so, basically I am worried this perma CC for free will become to over powered 

Q: the extra arrows at five stacks: Im worried they will apply a slow and you can keep the extra arrows infinitely as long as you keep attacking, also no mana cost on them?

W: cone width reduction but more arrows seems wonky to me...and might hurt ashe more than help her.

E: no more extra gold on last hits? this was a pretty neat feature to get ahead, Ill miss it.
E: global vision control?! if the CD is very short and the mana cost not very high, say goodbye to ever safely securing a dragon or baron with an enemy ashe around who can hawkshot every few moments to check it

replies.body:
> QUESTIONS FOR RIOT
1) Aren't you worried that Ashe will become to powerful with the perma-slow and it having no negative effect on ashe now?
2) On Ashe's Q will the extra arrows scale with DMG and also apply a slow? once you hit 5 stacks, if this is the case
Doesn't that make it possible she can also have those extra arrows with no negative effects to her as long as she keeps attacking?
3) Why did you reduce the width of the cone for her arrows but add more arrows?
4) Why does her hawkshot no longer grant gold?
5) What will the CD/negative effects be like to prevent the global hawkshot from being to overpowered in vision control

1. Somewhat concerned, but she effectively had permaslow before (albeit with a mana cost), and this version starts with a lower base than the Live rank 1 15% slow, so there's probably a numbers-balanced version available.
2. The 5 arrows per attack on her Q have their own AD ratio, something like .23/.24/.25/.26/.27 for a Total AD ratio of 1.15/1.20/1.25/1.30/1.35 per basic attack while it is active. They all apply the slow. Q is a spell with a somewhat long cooldown, so she can't just have it active forever.
3. First of all, it's only very very marginally narrower. We increased the number of arrows and put better blocking gameplay in (by allowing enemies to get hit by several arrows, but only damaged by the first) so that opponents can better play against Volley.
4. We've put power in several places with these Ashe changes, but that meant we had to take some out in others, and small bonus gold on kill isn't all that sexy, even if it does have some small wins attached to it.
5. Hawkshot's base recharge time is very long (90 seconds at rank 1 and going down substantially with rank from there, I believe), because we also agree that this change is scary. But we also think it has the potential to be pretty darn cool. As she's tested on PBE and in her first few weeks on Live, we'll determine what these cooldown values should be in order to make sense, but ultimately, we thought this change really helped to emphasize Ashe's utility elements.

Hope this helps to answer your questions.

Cheers,
Repertoir

> 1- Are you glad for the buffs?

Not sure if they're buffs yet (still waiting for full numbers; [Repertoir posted some on the PBE Boards](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay-feedback/6BBcWPLy-ashe-update-feedback-thread?), but withholding judgement until it hits live), the crit change seems like a big deal, especially since crit is pseudo RNG and not true RNG, she might actually be losing some DPS late game, I'm not sure about the math tbh

> 2- What do you think of her new kit?

It looks like a lot of fun, I'm excited to try it out, regardless of nerf/buffs. The greater consistency in damage is nice, will help not messing up CS with random crits, and also gauging fights. Her Q looks so freaking cool. Her W looks nerfed, but especially with the power she's gaining in her Q and passive, it doesn't seem like a gamebreaking nerf. The passive gold was really nice, I'll miss it (or just build an early avarice blade; crit gives her a bit of flat damage with her passive now, so it isn't as terrible of a buy), but the global Hawkshot is much appreciated, especially considering Ashe is *the* utility ADC and yet Kalista arguably had better vision control

> 3- any ideas for possible new meta builds?

According to Repertoir, BC stacks on each arrow of her empowered Q (though the multiple shots only work on the first shot for some things, like BotRK and Braum's passive, for obvious reasons, I think), so BC might be good, especially with the Phage passive, maybe in place of LW. I'm also thinking IBG might also be pretty *cool* (sorrynotsorry) with her passive synergy. They still look like they're pushing IE as core, and SS looks like it synergizes pretty well, but BoTRK might be more common, especially with the 5.8 changes. Again, waiting for numbers to see what's actually mathematically best; it definitely feels like she has more options now, maybe too many XD

Overall really excited for the changes, hopefully other immobile ADCs (ie. MF, Varus) will get some good updates to help them compete with the other immobile powerhouses (ie. Jinx, Koggles).

Contrary to popular belief, cleaver is NOT great on her because she can fully stack it in one Q-aa, though I suppose that lets you switch targets during a teamfight.

It's great on her because Ashe needs the stats it gives (cdr for more ults and vision, a little tankiness, and a mini jinx passive), and makes up for its deficiency (takes time to ramp up damage) with a permaslow and the fact that ashe's own damage is largely delayed, so you're not missing out on *that* much by having lower armor pen on your first few auto-attacks.

Finally, we need to talk about towers. Ashe with a 5-stacks Q on a tower is almost as good, maybe better (because of her range), at tower-pushing than Jinx. Less reliable, because she needs an enemy minion wave to stack up on or she's just "meh" at it, but also safer, with more range.

I actually just finished my first PBE test on her too (Mac bug kept me out of commission until now). Overall initial impressions are positive, my favorite parts about her are still intact for the most part (her utility/CC, her W burst, her buttery smooth AA), and, as you mentioned, she's more engaging.

*RE: Damage output*

Your impressions are more or less consistent with mine (barring differences due to our builds). Her sustained damage feels really nice, especially with the spikes that her Q offers. If you're near a minion wave/monster camp or firing on multiple people, it isn't difficult to stack your Q really quickly at the start of a fight. I felt more like the Q steroid was more of a nice boost, less required for her DPS, just because she has guaranteed crit with her passive. I need a bit more practice utilizing it fully, but she still feels pretty strong even without it.

*RE: CS, Kit, and Gold*

I had a bit of trouble gauging the crit damage on my second shots for CS, messed a few up because of that, but that's just something to get used to, and is easier to get used to because no RNG. I didn't find the W block too significant; you just need to find different angles to fire from, which is sort of what I do on live Ashe since poking with W through minions isn't terribly reliable (or I'm just missing the secret). E was a buff for me, just because I constantly overestimate the range on it and end up just awkwardly walking around instead of firing the Hawkshot. She's losing a significant amount of gold, but a silver lining is that Avarice blade isn't as bad an early buy on her just because the crit chance = reliable damage for her now, and the guaranteed crits means Frenzy mastery is up constantly, meaning you can afford to wait a bit on buying AS. Her Q I still need more practice on using optimally, but overall I like it.

*RE: Build and BC*

So my build path was BFSword > Avarice Blade > IE > Runaan's > Furor Zerker Greaves > BC > BT > SS. I had a chance to fiddle around with BotRK instead of BT, and PD over Runaan's, but not enough to make a definitive assessment, at least on the latter. I feel like the early Avarice Blade is situational, since it's still not a great item for laning, but you can rack up a good amount of gold just by keeping with you for the entire game, and with BFS her AD is pretty good so 10% crit on top of that is decent.

Still undecided about the Runaan's; damage wise it's inferior to SS and PD, on single targets at least or especially, because no crit, plus no MS that she uses, but the bolts stack her Q so fast and, with BC, she can shred an entire team so quickly with her Q active. Plus it just looks cool :P.

Also kind of mixed about BC, over LW. She has less immediate burst but great sustained damage, so BC isn't terrible on her imo, but part of me still feels like ADCs rather have the up-front pen of LW, even if Ashe can stack it super fast. At the same time, though, BC has so many benefits, as you mentioned. Her ult CD felt so much shorter. I didn't think the Phage passive was as noticeable as Furor, but I guess when you have no mobility skills, you take every bit you can get :P. The extra HP is great though, coupled with the BT shield. I'm not sure if she wants more upfront offensive ability with the LW to make up for the fact she isn't getting crits up front, or if she synergizes better with the ramp up of BC, since her damage kind of ramps up in a fight as well. Maybe they're situational.

Speaking of BT vs BotRK, I feel like BT is superior, just because she's got more AD ratios. Maybe I'm just distracted because a bigger number pops up with BT, but stacking AD seems like the way to go, since Ashe doesn't really scale with on-hits as well as other ADCs. The other consideration, though, is that the active on BotRK does help her kite, so there's that. However, with my build, the attack speed on BotRK didn't really feel noticeable, because Runaan's.

*RE: Towers*

I just might have not been paying attention, but I almost felt like she was losing damage on towers with her Q, because towers have a lot of armor. Probably just my imagination, or seeing smaller numbers pop up on attacking towers, lol. She's still great in sieges between her range, poke, and vision control to watch for flanks.
